title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: About three miles beyond Dalserf, the tourist crosses the river Nethan, at Nethanfoot.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Nearly six miles from Hamilton, the Edinburgh road to Ayr crosses the Clyde at Garrion Bridge, which derives its name from a seat of Lord Belhaven's, in the immediate vicinity, and a short way on is the village of Dalserf, celebrated for its orchards.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: columns, each 25 feet high, and fully 10 feet span, formed of a solid block of stone, quarried in Dalserf ; each of which required to be drawn by 30 horses.

title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: His mother was of the Whiteford family, and so poor that she retired to a town or place near to Dalserf, called Millown, where she earned subsistence for herself and son by spinning.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: " My puir bairn, thou hast nowhere else to go; forthy father is in exde, and Hamdton of Dalserf holdshis castle and barony of Kilspindie."

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Countess of Arran, the ladies of Barncleugh and Evandale, Dalserf and Drumrye, of Raploch, and others, aUwives aud daughters of knights and gentlemen of thehostile surname, were gazing stofidly upon her.
